definition: Eastern Zhou (770-221 BC)
surname Dong
east/host (i.e. sitting on east side of guest)/landlord
surname Zhou/Zhou Dynasty (1046-256 BC)
to make a circuit/to circle/circle/circumference/lap/cycle/complete/all/all over/thorough/to help financially
week/weekly/variant of 周[zhou1]

sentences.english: This feign, the Eastern Zhou Dynasty is planted afresh certainly paddy, when reaping, you capture again they.
sentences.chinese: 这佯，东周一定重新种稻，收割时您再夺取它们。

sentences.english: Maoqinggou cemetery was located in Liangcheng County, Inner Mongolia, dated back to the Eastern Zhou Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 毛庆沟墓地是内蒙古凉城县东周时期的墓地。

sentences.english: The Eastern Zhou period is also designated as a period of a hundred schools.
sentences.chinese: 东周时期也被指定为一个时期的百家争鸣。

sentences.english: In a word. East River Region was the economic barycenter of Lingnan in Eastern Zhou Period.
sentences.chinese: 归纳之，东周时期东江流域是岭南的经济重心。

sentences.english: Donghu is a branch of the Hu people who act actively in the Northeast of Yan.
sentences.chinese: 东胡是东周时期活跃于燕国东北面的一支胡人。

sentences.english: The research on pictorial bronzes of Eastern Zhou is a major subject of study on art history and archeology.
sentences.chinese: 东周画像铜器是美术史和考古学研究的重要课题。

sentences.english: The War of Yan Ducal in the Eastern Zhou Dynasty and Its Role in the History;
sentences.chinese: 东周画像铜器是美术史和考古学研究的重要课题。

sentences.english: Eastern Zhou Dynasty(771B. C. -221B. C. ) is firmly thought of a glorious period in culture of Chinese ancient history.
sentences.chinese: 东周时期一向被认为是我国古代历史文明的光辉时代。

sentences.english: Chapter three is on bronze weapons of the Eastern Zhou .
sentences.chinese: 第三章讨论东周时期的青铜兵器。

definition: Western Zhou (1027-771 BC)
the Spring and Autumn (770-476 BC) and Warring States (475-221 BC) periods
the Zhou dynasty from 1027 BC
final name of the Shang dynasty after their move to Yinxu 殷墟 in modern Henan province
Zhou Dynasty/Western Zhou 西周 (1046-771 BC) and Eastern Zhou 東周|东周 (770-221 BC)
Shang Dynasty (c. 1600-1046 BC)
Xia, Shang and Zhou, the earliest named Chinese dynasties
Xia dynasty, unconfirmed but placed at c. 2070-c. 1600 BC
vassal state
the Warring States period (475-221 BC)
Han dynasty (206 BC-220 AD)/refers to the Western Han and Eastern Han
pre-Qin, Chinese history up to the foundation of the Qin imperial dynasty in 221 BC
Xia Dynasty (2070-1600 BC)
Western Han Dynasty (206 BC-8 AD), also called 前漢|前汉[Qian2 Han4], Former Han Dynasty
late Warring States period, c. 250-221 BC before the First Emperor's Qin Dynasty
the state of Chu, one of the most important of the small states contending for power in China between 770 and 223 BC, located around present-day Hubei
